models.animals

Class Animal

  • java.lang.Object
    • models.animals.Animal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AnimalInterface
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bear, Eagle, Fish, Penguin, Shark, Tiger, Whale, Wolf

    public class Animal
extends java.lang.Object
implements AnimalInterface

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected int age
      Represents the age of an animal 1 = young, 2 = adult, 3 = old
      protected int childrenCreationTime
      Represents the time required for a child to birth/hatch, as a number of turns
      protected int copulationTurn
      Defines the turn number at which the animal copulated, allowing us to calculate the difference with the current turn number to compare with the gestation time
      protected int healthIndicator
      Represents the current health of the animal, as a percentage, where 1 is low health and 100 is full health
      protected int hungerIndicator
      Represents the current hunger level of an animal, as a percentage, where 1 is very hungry, and 100 is not hungry
      protected boolean isInEnclosure
      Represents a boolean indicating whether or not the animal is currently in an enclosure
      protected boolean sex
      Represents the sex of the Animal, where true equals Male, and false equals Female
      protected float size
      Represents the size of the Animal, in centimeters
      protected boolean sleepIndicator
      Represents the current sleep state of the Animal, having true for currently sleeping, and false for awake
      protected java.lang.String specieName
      Represents the specie name of the Animal, which is basically it's class name in a String
      protected float weight
      Represents the weight of the Animal, in grammes

      Animal()

      Allows a copulation between 2 animals Will be redefined by all children classes

      void      		 copulate(A animal, int turnNb)
      Allows a copulation between Mammals specifically (the behaviour is the same, we're just using it for the typing)

      Returns the current health level

      Returns the hunger level of the current animal
      void getOlder()
      Allows to make the animal get older Will increment to the next step, if not at the maximum value, which is 3

      Allows to randomly generate a boolean, used for the sex definition in case of a 'natural' birth

      • setAge

        public void setAge(int age)
        Setter for the animal age
        Parameters:
        age - The new animal age. Can be 1, 2 or 3 for Young, Adult and Old. If given a greater value, the animal will die at the next turn

      • copulate

        public <A extends AnimalInterface> Animal copulate(A animal,
                                                   int turnNb)
        Allows a copulation between 2 animals Will be redefined by all children classes
        Specified by:
        copulate in interface AnimalInterface
        Type Parameters:
        A - Generic type used for the animals parameter, which is here a type extending AnimalInterface
        Parameters:
        animal - The animal which will perform the copulation with the animal that calls the method
        turnNb - The current turn number

      • copulate

        public <A extends Mammal> void copulate(A animal,
                                        int turnNb)
        Allows a copulation between Mammals specifically (the behaviour is the same, we're just using it for the typing)
        Type Parameters:
        A - Generic type used for the animals parameter, which is here a type extending Mammal
        Parameters:
        animal - The animal which will perform the copulation with the animal that calls the method
        turnNb - The current turn number
